meanings.definition: embodying in flesh or taking on a bodily form
meanings.sent1: The incarnating spirit brought warmth and life to the room.
meanings.sent2: The cat's incarnating presence made the house feel cozy.
meanings.sent3: The incarnating puppy wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: Her incarnating smile lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The incarnating sun painted the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: manifesting or expressing in a physical form
meanings.sent1: The incarnating stars twinkled in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: His incarnating anger was evident in his clenched fists.
meanings.sent3: The incarnating storm rumbled in the distance.
meanings.sent4: The incarnating music filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The incarnating flower bloomed beautifully in the garden.

meanings.definition: giving concrete form to an idea or concept
meanings.sent1: The incarnating of her dream into a successful business was inspiring.
meanings.sent2: The artist's incarnating of emotions into his paintings was remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The incarnating of the party theme into decorations was fun.
meanings.sent4: The incarnating of words into a powerful speech moved the audience.
meanings.sent5: The incarnating of love into actions spoke louder than words.
